Class LibraryMember

java.lang.Object
LibraryMember
public class LibraryMember extends Object
Represents a library member who can borrow and return physical books.

Each library member has a unique ID and a list of borrowed books.

Provides methods for borrowing, returning, and viewing borrowed books.

Version 1.1 Notes:
- Added the getDetails method to generate member details as a String.
- Modified the printDetails method to use getDetails for better testability

Version:
1.1
Author:
Neil Hutton

    • getBorrowedBooks

      public List<PhysicalBook> getBorrowedBooks()
      Gets the list of books currently borrowed by the library member.
      Returns:
      a copy of the list of borrowed books for immutability

    • addBorrowedBook

      public void addBorrowedBook(PhysicalBook book)
      Adds the specified book to the member's list of borrowed books.

      This method does not handle broader lending logic, such as checking whether the book is already borrowed by another member or is available in the library. Such validation is performed by the Library.lendBook(PhysicalBook, LibraryMember) method.

      This method only ensures that the book is added to the list if it is not already present.

      Parameters:
      book - the book to add to the borrowed books list

    • removeBook

      public void removeBook(PhysicalBook book)
      Removes the specified book from the member's list of borrowed books.

      This method does not validate whether the book is being returned to the library or if it belongs to this library's catalog. Such logic is handled in the Library.acceptBookReturn(PhysicalBook, boolean, java.lang.String) method.

      This method only ensures that the book is removed from the list if it is currently present.

      Parameters:
      book - the book to remove from the borrowed books list

    • numberOfBorrowedBooks

      public int numberOfBorrowedBooks()
      Gets the number of books currently borrowed by the library member.
      Returns:
      the number of borrowed books

    • getDetails

      public String getDetails()
      Generates a string containing the details of the library member.
      Returns:
      a string representation of the library member's details

    • printDetails

      public void printDetails()
      Prints the details of the library member to the console.
